The Saved Reports and Booklets Catalog

The Saved Reports and Booklets catalog contains reports and booklets that you have created and saved as well as those that have been shared with you. Booklets and sharing are covered later in this section. As shown here, you can specify how you would like your saved reports to be sorted in the display; by modification date, creation date, or alphabetical order. Also, you can perform a text search to find specific reports. The text search is applied to the report name and the report author’s name.

The blank page icon denotes a report that you have saved, while the right (outward) – facing arrow signifies a report that you have saved and shared with other users. The left-facing arrow on the page icon denotes reports that someone else has shared with you.

To open a report, click anywhere in the report description to open up the action menu. Clicking VIEW will open (i.e. execute) the report. The EDIT button will bring you back into the Report Builder screen, where you can edit that report’s definition. This part is covered later in this section. The COPY will create a new duplicate version of that report. The DELETE operation will delete the report entirely if you created it, and delete it from your catalog if someone else shared it with you. The SHARE feature allows you to push the report to another user and is covered later in this section.
